content:
Here’s my recent deep dive writeup on $MU
jonahlupton.substack.com/p/mu
@joespooner I still have my $CLPT so fuck off

Cowen resumes coverage of $DMTK with buy rating and $50 PT which is 55% upside from current prices. 

I will try to get my hands on the report. 

$DMTK is now my 4th largest position because I’m expecting a rally into Q3 earnings and the launch of Luminate which could be coming any day now.

Here’s a trade idea:  
yesterday $PAVM pulled back 14% and bounced off this trend line which has provided prior support on two occasions. I started a position yesterday on this bounce. I have a stop loss at $6.35 in case we don’t hold and retest the lows from yesterday.

I’ve been waiting for this news from $UPST since the Prodigy acquisition and it’s finally here… $UPST just launched software for auto dealers/retailers with built in AI-powered/enabled financing. 

ir.upstart.com/news-release...

This is huge because auto lending is 10x bigger than personal lending. Bullish

To say that $CELH is growing faster than their competitors and/or their category might be one of the biggest understatements ever  👀 

I don’t just love the product, I also love the stock 🔥 Bullish

I like this setup on $SNAP, consolidation over 35 trading sessions since gap up, 50d moving averages catching up 

I know they are different industries but let's compare $SNAP and $SHOP:

2021 for $SNAP
$4.2B revs
67% YoY rev growth
56% gross margins
$2.35B gross profit
$117B EV
trading at 49x 2021 EV/GP

2021 for $SHOP
$4.6B revs
58% YoY rev growth
54% gross margins
$2.48B gross profit
$181B EV
trading at 73x 2021 EV/GP

2022 for $SNAP
$6.2B revs
47.5% YoY rev growth
61% gross margins
$3.78B gross profit
$117B EV
trading at 31x 2022 EV/GP with 47.5% rev growth

2022 for $SHOP
$6.2B revs
34% YoY rev growth
53% gross margins
$3.28B gross profit
$181B EV
trading at 55x 2022 EV/GP with 34% rev growth

$SNAP is a better buy that $SHOP
$SNAP is growing faster, has better margins and trades at lower multiple

$SNAP is expected to have 21% EBITDA margins in 2022 versus $SHOP at 13% EBITDA margins

It's also possible that we see $SNAP added to the S&P 500 in the next 6-12 months.

I'll be interviewing John Carrington, CEO of $STEM on Wednesday at 11am EST.

Register to watch live: us06web.zoom.us/webinar/reg...

The entire interview will be recorded and posted at youtube.com/c/jonahluptonme...

Please feel free to comment with any questions you'd like me to ask him.

Here's a Twitter thread that I just posted comparing all of the ecommerce companies: $AMZN $SHOP $GLBE $SE $MELI $ETSY $FTCH $OZON $BABA $PDD $JD $W $EBAY $WISH 

I used enterprise value, gross margins, gross profit, revenue growth and EV/GP as the main metric.

There's no doubt that $OZON looks the most attractive and most undervalued by a wide margin which is why I own it and added to the position this morning. 

twitter.com/jonahlupton/sta... Bullish
@knadella @NickBryant i'm still holding $FUTU
I hope $UPST is ready to explode especially after those $LC earnings today -- we could see some strong buying before $UPST reports Q2 earnings on August 10th Bullish

This writeup on $UPST is from April but it’s very good 

seekingalpha.com/article/44... Bullish

Here's my recent interview with Dr. Laura Niklason, CEO of Humacyte and Rajiv Shukla from Alpha Healthcare SPAC 

youtube.com/watch?v=sCHj0ju...

Humacyte is developing lab-grown human tissues and vessels which could eventually include human organs.

I don’t currently have a position in $HUMA (the merger should be complete in the next 4-6 weeks) however this is a stock/company that I’m watching very closely and it’s very possible I take a position in the next 3-6 months as the company applies for FDA approval and then begins to scale up production and revenues in late 2022 through 2023.

If Humacyte is able to meet expectations then this stock has enormous upside — I just don’t expect it to be an overnight success so you should have plenty of time to start a position assuming you’re willing to be patient and bet on the long term.

youtube.com/watch?v=sCHj0ju...

This is huge news for $UPST and gets them one step closer to enabling thousands of banks and financial institutions to incorporate AI into their lending 🚀

ir.upstart.com/news-release... Bullish

Josh Brown on CNBC just mentioned $UPST as one of his favorite stocks to buy right now

This pushed $UPST from $117 to $122 in a matter of minutes.

Josh made all the important points -- there are thousands of banks that need to start incorporating AI into their lending but they don't have the expertise or resources to develop it themselves so they will turn to $UPST for help. 

$UPST is still my top idea for the rest of 2021 🚀 Bullish

This could be huge news for $UPST
$UPST was just announced as a preferred partner for NAFCU which is the National Association of Federally-insured Credit Unions. 

More than 115 million Americans are members of credit unions. 

businesswire.com/news/home/... Bullish

Here is my interview from earlier today with Arthur Chen, CFO of $FUTU
youtube.com/watch?v=GaVGPzo...

Please share this interview on Stocktwits, Reddit, Twitter and anywhere else you can. Let's get $FUTU to $200 by end of summer 🚀

I believe $FUTU will do $1.2 billion in revenues this year so the stock is currently trading at 33x 2021 earnings. 

$FUTU is growing revenues at 180% YoY and earnings at 240% YoY.

$FUTU should be 60% higher 🚀 Bullish
Looks like the big funds are starting to load up on $UPST and $DMTK 🔥 Bullish

Last week I shared on Twitter that my friend Sophie was diagnosed with brain cancer.

Yesterday she posted on Facebook she was looking for a stationary bike so I decided to setup a GoFundMe fundraiser to get her a new Peloton bike $PTON 

I donated $250 to kick things off 🙏🏼

Even if you can only donate $10 it would mean a lot to me.

Sophie is going through a very difficult time so I'm hoping to give her something to smile about during her recovery.

gofundme.com/f/lets-get-sop...
@Dizingof @JonahLupton not sure why you are tagging me on this since I don’t think this comment was about $NNOX

Yesterday a group of people from FinTwit jumped on Twitter Spaces to talk about our favorite FinTech stocks. I decided to talk about $UPST which is my largest position.

I spent the first couple minutes adding a few comments about $FUTU which was the stock that was covered before I went plus it's my second largest position so I know the company well. 

Here's my 15+ minute talk about $UPST: youtube.com/watch?v=ztdOGNg...

You can listen to the full 2 hours and 40+ minutes at:  youtube.com/watch?v=9C76FYX...
@Pavlos21 $FUTU revenues were $426M last year, you are probably looking at the wrong currency
@jdkinnovations I still like $TMDX but we need to see what happens with the FDA decision

Yesterday I spoke on Twitter spaces for 60 minutes about why I still like small caps, how I handle the increased risk/volatility and why I'm still bullish on $UPST $FUTU $DMTK $CELH $CLPT $OZON $NIO $ATER (formerly $MWK) 

Listen here: youtube.com/watch?v=j6bOPRH...

Today I'm interviewing the founder & CEO of $FUV aka arcimoto.com/

Let me know if you have any questions you'd like me to ask. 

Register to watch: zoom.us/webinar/register/WN...

They make these ultra efficient EVs which start at $17,999 (too expensive in my opinion) but they are moving into a larger facility and ramping up production in hopes of bringing costs down (the goal is under $12,000).

They do look super fun to ride/drive and I see lots of potential uses among consumers, food delivery companies (last mile logistics) and even first responders. 

Company video: youtube.com/watch?v=OklBN3C...

Here's the investor presentation: cdn.arcimoto.com/wp/2021040...
@cyclops72 I’m doing a public interview with the $LFMD CEO next week.
$TMDX 🔥

Here's why I love $UPST
$UPST announced 2020 revenues last week which were good but the big news was raising 2021 revenue guidance to $500 million -- it's fair to assume this was conservative guidance and also doesn't include any revenues from their new acquisition called Prodigy (software for auto dealers to help generate auto loans). From last Thursday to yesterday $UPST went up 3x in 3 days then yesterday pulled back 28% to under $119 which puts the market cap under $8.9 billion -- this means $UPST is under 18x sales with at least 115% revenue growth with gross margins at 84% and contribution margins at 46%. $UPST is now way too cheap at $118 and could be back to $150+ in the next few weeks if the markets stabilize.

Here's why I love $FUTU
$FUTU reported 2020 financial results a couple weeks ago and they were insane (some of the best I've ever seen). $FUTU grew revenues last year at 212% with 79% gross margins and 41% net income margins -- so they're extremely profitable too. In all my years of investing I don't think I've ever seen a company with metrics this strong. 

$FUTU has pulled back from the late February highs of $205 and the more recent pre-earnings levels in the $140s all the way down to $115 as of yesterday's close. This is laughable. 

Based on analysts estimates, $FUTU should do $900 million to $1.1 billion in 2021. Let's split the difference and say $1 billion. This mean means $FUTU is now trading at 15x sales with at least 120% revenue growth, 79% gross margins and 45% net margins. 

I think $FUTU could be a $200 stock in the next few months especially once we see the Robinhood valuation and what that P/S multiple might be.
@knadella I still like $NIO especially at these prices

$CELH !!!!!!!! 

My most recent Substack writeup just went out to all the free subscribers (paid subscribers got it last week): jonahlupton.substack.com/p/...

Everyone knows that I've been bullish on $CELH since last summer but I finally did an official Substack writeup to explain why.

Here is the rest of this thread which I just posted on twitter: twitter.com/jonahlupton/sta...

If you own $CELH or have thought about starting a position I suggest you read my writeup ASAP.

Here is my recent Substack writeup on $AEYE -- went out today to my free subscribers -- jonahlupton.substack.com/p/...
$AEYE is up 17.5% today however anyone that was a paid subscriber to my Substack could have bought bought the stock 25% cheaper on Wednesday. 

I also told everyone in my Stocktwits room over the past two weeks that I was adding to my $AEYE position so I'm hoping that many of you already own the stock.

$AEYE is not only on a mission to build a more accessible and inclusive internet for everyone but revenues are growing at 55-65% with 73-75% gross margins. 

After you read the writeup feel free to ask me any questions.

Here is my $CELH thread that I just posted on Twitter -- twitter.com/jonahlupton/sta...

I think the rollout of branded coolers is going to be huge for $CELH not to mention these massive displays

Solid earnings report from $CELH -- stock is down 28% today despite 74% YoY growth 

$CELH under $45 should be a nice entry price for anyone looking to start a position or anyone adding to an existing position 

I'm on the earnings call right now and I remain very bullish. The company is facing some growing pains but they'll get through them and come out much stronger on the other end.

celsiusholdingsinc.com/wp-c...

Yesterday afternoon I had the pleasure of interviewing Dr. John Dobak, CEO of DermTech (ticker = $DMTK).

$DMTK is making some incredible breakthroughs with their genomics smart patches for early skin cancer detection (melanoma).

$DMTK remains the largest position in my personal account because I’m extremely bullish on this company for the next 3+ years. I believe $DMTK has a very bright future with a robust pipeline as we discussed in the interview.

Learn more about $DMTK at: dermtech.com/

Learn more about their new UV damage product that launches later this year: luminatedna.com/
youtube.com/watch?v=NSZa8Ha...
$VGAC is merging with 23andMe to take them public. You can access the investor presentation at the bottom on this press release (I'm watching it now) vgacquisition.com/press_rel...

@howardlindzon $UPST (AI powered underwriting), $DMTK (genomics based smart patch for early skin cancer detection), $PRCH (the homeowner operating platform), $INSP (helping 10+ million people with sleep apnea), $BAND (CPaaS company growing at 38% but trading at only 9x sales), $STIC (Barkbox, merger coming up, growing at 50% with 60% gross margins, 1 million monthly subs)

For all of my fellow $STIC shareholders (aka @Barkbox) the company is hosting an investor presentation at 2pm EST today. 

You can join at zoom.us/w/91950561472?tk=u8...

If you're not familiar with $STIC (soon to be $BARK) you can read my writeup at jonahlupton.substack.com/p/...
@Hammer12 stock is $ZYXI and market cap is under $700 million
@ZB1990 stock is $ZYXI and market cap is under $700 million
@bigreddddddd stock is $ZYXI and market cap is under $700 million
@SeekingSecurity stock is $ZYXI and market cap is under $700 million
$ATER 🚀
This is why $CELH is a top 5 position for me and why I continue to add on pullbacks. $CELH is crushing it 🚀 Bullish

Last week I did a webinar with TrendSpider and explained the types of stocks I invest in, how I find them and how I use the technicals to determine entry and exit points. I also explain why I sold $FSLY and $NNOX last week. You should fast forward to the 26 minute mark if you just want to watch my segment. Enjoy!!! youtube.com/watch?v=cuyISmK...
I forgot to mention $DMTK - that was my stock pick/writeup a couple weeks ago.

Lots of green on my screen this morning.

I'm fully invested so I won't be doing much buying today. If we get any pullbacks on the open I might nibble at some positions but overall I'm happy with my portfolio.

I hope some of you jumped into $DNMR on Friday afternoon like I recommended because it's up 11% pre-market.

I sold $DOCU last week because I only want to own stocks that I believe can go up 5x over the next 5 years and since $DOCU is already a $43B company I don't see them going to $215B by 2026.

I'm having the same debate this morning on $CRWD $TDOC $SE $SQ $NIO -- I believe these are the only $20B+ market cap companies that I have left. I do think each of them has more upside than $DOCU which is why I still own them. 

I probably won't be starting any new positions today.

My next newsletter stock writeup comes out today, you can subscribe at jonahlupton.substack.com/su... -- my last 7 picks/writeups were $FUTU $ATER $UPST $STIC $BAND $MMYT $INSP

Another wild month for the markets and my portfolio. Things were going great until the nonsense/chaos this week. I was up 60% coming into this week but the selloffs on Wednesday and Friday hurt me -- but I was still up 47.5% so I won't complain. 

Portfolio update: docs.google.com/spreadsheet...

Jonah:
Day: -1.6%
January: +47.5%

Indexes in January:
Dow: -2.0%
Nasdaq: +1.4%
S&P: -1.1%
Russell: +4.9%
Average: +0.8%

Recap for today:
- monster day for $IPOE
- great day for $HIMS
- good day for $LEV $STPK
- bad day for $DNMR $GRWG $CELH $MMYT $ZYXI $CLPT
- no new positions
- sold $DOCU because I'm focusing on stocks that can 5x over next 5 years and I don't see $DOCU as a $215B company in 2026
Just added aggressively to $OZON at $48 on pullback to 50d WMA Bullish

I just loaded up on $PRCH because it pulled back to 50 day WMA. 

$PRCH is growing revenues at 130% with 75% gross margins and a market cap of just $1 billion. 

I think this could be an $8-10 company in 5 years so I’m expecting some monster returns. Bullish

Here's my recent write-up on $INSP (Inspire Medical): 
jonahlupton.substack.com/p/...

You can subscribe at jonahlupton.substack.com/su...

$CELH has pulled back 20% from the highs and approaching 50d wma, if we see $CELH dip below $52 I'll be loading up even though it's already my 4th largest position from adding the past couple days. $CELH is already taking shelf space from Monster and Red Bull, this will continue.

We could see more stocks today with high short interest rally hard as the hedge funds continue to cover some of their short positions out of fear the WallStreetBet's people will come after their stocks next and create the next $GME type short squeeze. 

I have a feeling this is why some of my stocks were up big yesterday like $FSLY $NNOX $ZYXI etc -- I sold $FSLY and $NNOX at the highs because the valuations just got too crazy for me. 

I'm definitely not chasing the garbage stocks with high short interest but good luck to anyone who wants to play that game. Just be careful. These stocks can drop just as fast as they went up.
$CELH is back under $60 so I just increased my position by 30% because this is the next $MNST

For the past couple weeks I've been telling people to sell their $TWLO and get into $BAND because the difference in price/sales multiple was unjustified -- looks like I was right. $BAND is still going higher.

Portfolio update: docs.google.com/spreadsheet...

- monster day for $LCID
- great day for $CLPT
- very good day for $CLSK
- good day for $NIO $ATER $TDOC $ZYXI
- bad day for $TIGR $PRCH
- started no positions
- sold no positions
- added to 1/2 of my stocks today

Day: +2.9%
YTD: +59.9%

My $DMTK stock writeup just went out to my 12,000+ free Substack subscribers. My paid subscribers got the writeup on Monday when the stock was 15% cheaper. You can signup at jonahlupton.substack.com/su...

You can read my writeup on $DMTK at jonahlupton.substack.com/p/...

I think this company has the potential to be a 10 bagger over the next 3-5 years.

One of the reasons I sold my $FVRR last week and $PTON a couple weeks ago was because I was afraid the analysts would start coming out with downgrades based on valuation concerns. Looks like it’s finally starting. $PTON also got a downgrade today.

Over the past couple weeks I've been building a 4% position in $DMTK 

If you want to know why I'm so bullish on this company I encourage you to watch this presentation and pay extra attention around the 4 minute mark.

icrinc.touchcast.com/showti...

$LEV $LCID and $DMTK are flying after hours :)

Updated portfolio & performance: docs.google.com/spreadsheet...

Today's activity: 

- sold: $PLTR $FUV $TRIRF

- added to: $BAND $UPST $ATER $NIU $GRWG $CRWD $FUTU 

- started new position: $TIGR at $12

- strong day from $LCID $DMTK $LEV $MAPS $CLSK $NET $NNOX

- up 1.3% for day + 1.5% after hours 
- up 36.94% YTD including after hours today

To the 1200+ people that follow me on Stocktwits, I wanted to mention that 90% of everything I post on here is actually in my private room which costs $10/month and includes all of my daily market commentary and trading activity. You can subscribe at stocktwits.com/r/Findingthe...

I also post my best stock ideas with my research/analysis on Substack which costs $7/month or $70/year. You can subscribe at jonahlupton.substack.com/su...

My last 4 stock picks were $STIC $ATER $FUTU and $UPST which are up an average of 55% in just 2-3 weeks.

$DMTK is up 10% after hours on this news: investors.dermtech.com/news...

I've been loading up on this stock for a few weeks.

Few moves from me today...

I trimmed $FUTU at $66 and $ROKU at $400 and $FVRR at $232 and $LMND at $165 

I added to $LEV under $23 and $DMTK under $35 and $FUV under $15 and $UPST under $53 and $MMYT under $29 and $MAPS under $17 and $STIC under $15 and $DNMR under $26 and $PSFE under $15
@jimmynbobby @Cashtrodamus in what world does $BAND go to $90?

Yesterday after the closing bell $DMTK announced a stock offering and the stock looks to be down 8% pre market. I’m very bullish on this company for the next few years because they’ve developed a non invasive way to detect skin cancer using their patches. This stock offering will help them execute on their growth strategy. This was a 1% position yesterday but on this pullback I plan to double the size of my position to 2%. I think this stock could triple over the next 2 years.
@Cashtrodamus $VG is growing revenues at 5% while $BAND is growing revenues at 40%

I doubled my position in $BAND today at $148 

$BAND is turning into one of the most undervalued cloud/tech stocks on the planet.

$BAND is trading at 8x 2021 EV/sales multiple with 40% rev growth

$TWLO is trading at 22x 2021 EV/sales multiple with 35% rev growth

Makes no sense.

$BAND should be a $200+ stock and I would not touch $TWLO at these levels. Any fund manager with half a brain would sell half their $TWLO and put those proceeds into $BAND 

There's a good chance that $BAND goes into my Substack newsletter soon because it's just too undervalued to be ignored. If you are still looking for some tech/cloud exposure in 2021 this is where I'd start.

One of my favorite EV speculative stocks for 2021 is $FUV and the company just announced they are moving into a much larger manufacturing facility. This is extremely bullish activity for a company. CEO's don't take on this kind of risk unless they believe demand is about to explode and they need more capacity. I doubled my position today on this news. Bullish

Just published my newest Substack newsletter at jonahlupton.substack.com/p/...

The stock is $FUTU which everyone knows I've been bullish on for the past 3-4 weeks. It's up 20% in the past 2 days but there's still plenty of upside left.  

$FUTU is growing at 50% with 76% gross margins and 38% net margins. They should also earn at least $1.60 in EPS in 2021. This stock could easily go 100% higher over the next year. Bullish

I just started a position in $BAND pre-market at $160.30 

I gave a short analysis last night on here but it's pretty simple. I still like the CSaaS industry, growth should stay strong in 2021 at 38-40%, valuation is very reasonable at under 10x sales, they are already expanding internationally, $ZM is one of their biggest customers and the stock is 2-3x cheaper than $TWLO in terms of P/S. 

I believe in 2021 we'll see the larger, overvalued stocks like $TWLO see more sideways action while less expensive stocks like $BAND are able to close the valuation gap. 

With the new cash I have coming into my account next week, I'd most likely keep adding to $BAND. I think this is a $200+ stock in the next 3-4 months. Bullish

@Mrmikemusic I actually did a couple  swing trades in $UAVS this past spring, then I forgot all about them. The stock was rumored to be doing a deal with amazon but I don’t know if it ever came through.

I asked my Twitter followers for some small cap stock ideas and there were 250+ replies. Of all the stocks mentioned, the ones I plan on looking at closer are:

$PSFE - merging with Paysafe (payments, digital wallets) paysafe.com/us-en/
$VIEW - merging with View (smart glass) view.com/investor-relations
$AQB - creating a healthier farm raised Salmon aquabounty.com/about-us
$FUV - a new kind of EV three-wheel vehicle arcimoto.com/
$SGBX - shipping containers to create residential and commercial structures sgblocks.com
$NARI - extracting DVT's to save lives - inarimedical.com/
$CLPT - neuro navigation system for surgery  clearpointneuro.com/
$CLOV - merging with Clover Health (Medicare HMO/PPO)

$HIMS - merging with Hims&Hers (DTC health company) forhims.com/investors
$YALA - group chat platform - yallatech.ae/
$LGVW - merging with Butterfly (portable ultrasound) - butterflynetwork.com/

Looks like another rotation day from small caps to large caps. I also think some of the selling today is profit taking and recognizing of capital gains before the Biden administration takes over in which case cap gains rates might go up. 

If you've been waiting for an entry point on some small caps, it might be a good time to start nibbling. Some of the best names are down 10-15% over the past two days. 

Obviously I have no idea how long this rotation will last so I'm personally staying focused on the small/mid cap stocks that I believe will put up the strongest revenue/earnings growth in 2021 like $FUTU $ATER $TRIRF $STIC $CELH $UPST $MP $OZON $NIU $TTCF $MMYT $MAPS 

If you have any other small/mid cap growth companies that you think I should look into or potentially showcase in my newsletter, please let me know. 

Please not recommend or posts any stocks under $100M market cap or under $5 per share. Thanks. 

Good luck today. Don't get scared out of positions that you still like.

I woke up at 4am this morning and did 90 minutes of due diligence on $TRIRF which has been recommended to me by several people I trust. 

So far I really like what I see. I'm certainly no expert on trade finance but the TAM is huge, current needs are being unmet, $TRIRF seems to have a great solution using blockchain and the financials look phenomenal.

Revenues are growing at 100%, EBITDA margins are 66% and net income margins are 52%. These numbers are utterly insane. I have no idea why more people aren't talking about this company but it looks like a homerun to me. 

I have started a 2% position this morning and I'll be adding aggressively on pullbacks. 

This stock has had a nice run the past couple days so be cautious and use limit orders to add on pullbacks although I think this one is going much higher so don't get too hung up on entry price. Bullish

I hope everyone bought some $STIC this week because it's up 15% pre-market. This was my stock idea on Monday: jonahlupton.substack.com/p/...
$ATER is up another 5% pre-market. I also recommended this one on Monday at $12.75 -- it's now up 35% since my newsletter: jonahlupton.substack.com/p/...

I won't always be right with my ideas but so far these two look good.

I just sold another 15% of my $TSLA  at $645 -- I still love Elon and this company but given the $600+ billion market cap and the S&P inclusion behind us I just don't see as much upside in $TSLA over the next 3-6 months as I do in my other stocks.

My $TSLA position is now down to 5%
I just doubled my position in $UPST from 1.5% pre market to 3% on the pullback below $44. I think this could be a $60 stock in 2-3 months. Bullish

As we get closer to year end and my portfolio approaches 300% gains for the year I'll be doing a lot of trimming over the next week. 

Not only do I think this market is overdue for a small correction but I also have a lot of unrealized gains in my portfolio and I'd rather take those gains in 2020 when my income was down 90% versus taking them in 2021 when I expect my income to be back to normal (ie higher tax bracket). 

With that said I just trimmed 8% of my $SE, 12% of my $SQ, 15% of my $CRWD, 10% of my $FVRR,  10% of my $TDOC, 15% of my $TSLA, 10% of my $ETSY and 10% of my $FSLY 

Obviously I hope these stocks keep going up because I still own them but I'm now sitting on a decent chunk of cash to either add on pullbacks or keep adding smaller, higher growth stocks to my portfolio like $ATER $STIC $UPST $MMYT $LSPD $MAPS $MP 

My current portfolio: docs.google.com/spreadsheet...

Lots of great growth stocks down 2-5% today. I think after the carnage on Monday a lot of larger growth investors are selling today just in case we get more vaccine news over the weekend or Monday morning. It’s just impossible to predict those types of events so I’m staying fully invested because many of my stocks are simply undervalued at these prices. $TDOC is now trading at 13x 2021 sales despite consensus estimates of 50-70% rev growth. If I had more cash in my account I’d be buying $TDOC aggressively at these prices. I also added around 3pm to $CRWD $PTON $TSLA $FTCH $GRWG $APPS $DOCU
$FVRR is a beast today. This stock clearly wants to be at $200 soon.

Some interesting earnings today since I have positions in $PLTR and $FTCH. Both stocks are up 60% in the past month so I’m not going to chase them into earnings but I will add to my position today if we get any dip and then wait to see what they report after the bell. 

$CELH and $PDD both reported strong numbers this morning. Sadly I no longer have positions in either.

@merillon TBH I think there’s some risk for $AAPL $META $GOOG $MSFT and $AMZN but I still don’t see anything major happening especially with a Biden presidency because these big social media sites definitely lean liberal and definitely helped Biden win.

@merillon sure it’s always a concern with mega cap tech companies but I don’t see those risks big enough to outweigh the upside potential in this stock and breaking up $META would be good for shareholders. It would unlock a ton of value in Instagram and/or WhatsApp.

$META is my second largest position and 40-60% undervalued — could be trading at $500/share by end of next year.

Across their products/platforms $META has 3 billion monthly active users.

$META should maintain 20-30% revenue growth for the next 3-5 years as our addiction to social media continues. 

$META should be able to maintain 80-82% gross margins.

$META generates a ton of free cash flow and could have $100+ billion of cash on the balance sheet by end of next year.
